sentences.en: Alberg gave him a bleak stare.
sentences.cn: 阿尔伯格沮丧地凝视着他。

sentences.en: Bankruptcy now stares us in the face.
sentences.cn: 我们现在面临破产

sentences.en: Don't stare at me— it's impolite!
sentences.cn: 别盯着我看——这是不礼貌的！

sentences.en: Everton were staring defeat in the face.
sentences.cn: 埃弗顿正处于失败的边缘。

sentences.en: He fixes you with a piercing stare.
sentences.cn: 他用锐利的目光盯住你。

sentences.en: Henry gave Paul a glassy-eyed stare.
sentences.cn: 亨利木然地盯着保罗。

sentences.en: Her purposeful stare showed she meant business.
sentences.cn: 从她坚定的眼神可知她是认真的.

sentences.en: Hlasek gave him a long, cold stare.
sentences.cn: 赫拉塞克冷冷地盯着他看了好久。

sentences.en: I stare in rapture at the ball.
sentences.cn: 我欣喜若狂地盯着球。

sentences.en: It is bad manners to stare at people.
sentences.cn: 瞪着眼睛看人是不礼貌的.

sentences.en: It's not polite to stare at a girl in the face.
sentences.cn: 盯着姑娘的脸瞧是不礼貌的.

sentences.en: It's rude to stare at people.
sentences.cn: 盯着看人不礼貌.

sentences.en: Mahoney tried not to stare.
sentences.cn: 马奥尼尽力不去盯着看。

sentences.en: She gave him an angry stare.
sentences.cn: 她生气地白了他一眼.

sentences.en: She gave the stranger a wooden stare.
sentences.cn: 她呆头呆脑地瞧着那个陌生人.

sentences.en: She sat there staring into space (= looking for a long time at nothing ) .
sentences.cn: 她坐在那里，出神地凝视前方。

sentences.en: Stop trying to stare me out.
sentences.cn: 别想把我吓倒.

sentences.en: the answer had been staring him in the face.
sentences.cn: 那答案就曾一直在他的面前。

sentences.en: The explanation had been staring him in the face all along.
sentences.cn: 这解释对他来说一直是明明白白的

sentences.en: The money on the table was staring her in the face.
sentences.cn: 钱就在桌上，摆在她面前

sentences.en: The people there, quite raggedy, stare at us.
sentences.cn: 那里的人们，穿得很邋遢，盯着我们看。

words.tran_cn: 凝视的，目不转睛的；瞪着眼的；显眼的
凝视；盯着看；显眼（stare的ing形式）

phrases.phrase: be staring something in the face
phrases.tran_cn: 处于失败（或死亡等坏运气的）边缘
面临：紧急的或不可避免的
遵循先例；（拉）[律]根据过去判例
盯得局促不安：盯视或仿佛盯视而导致动摇或屈服

phrases.phrase: stare someone in the eye (或 face)

phrases.tran_cn: 瞪眼 把…看得不敢对视；瞪眼把…看得转过脸去

trans.tran_en: when you look at something for a long time in a steady way
to look at something or someone for a long time without moving your eyes, for example because you are surprised, angry, or bored
